definition: in charge (of a position etc)/the person in charge/responsible
owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
palm of the hand/sole of the foot/paw/horseshoe/to slap/to hold in one's hand/to wield

sentences.english: The original fortress expanded steadily until it started to host governmental affairs.
sentences.chinese: 最初的堡壘穩步擴張，直到它開始主掌政府事務處理。

sentences.english: The confederacy had no official head or chief executive officer .
sentences.chinese: 聯盟沒有一長制首長，即沒有主掌執行權的首腦。

sentences.english: Choose the best facilitator to chair the meeting.
sentences.chinese: 選擇最佳“主持人”來主掌整個會議。

definition: to govern/to have complete control over/to be in command of
to assume full responsibility/to be in full control/to monopolize
to wield (political etc) power/be in power
to act as a substitute/to act on sb's behalf
to work solely on/to have as one's (or its) sole function/person or agency responsible for one specific thing
